Pre-Game Insights: Portugal can shuffle the pack for this group stage finale as they have already secured the top spot in Group F.
Bernardo Silva and Bruno Fernandes were on target in their 3-0 win over Turkey at the weekend.
Georgia picked up their first-ever European Championships point in a 1-1 draw with Czechia.
Rafael Leao is suspended after bookings in both outings so far.
Cristiano Ronaldo, Bruno Fernandes, and Vitinha are among those players who could be rested.
Roberto Martinez has hinted at some squad rotation for Wednesday’s contest.
Goncalo Ramos, Diogo Jota, and Joao Felix are waiting in the wings as well as talented 19-year-old midfielder Joao Neves.
Georgia have threats on the counter-attack and had a glorious late chance against the Czechs.
Czechia outshot the Georgians 27-5 on Saturday.
Portugal should have the lion’s share of possession and are expected to take a lead into the half-time break.
Cristiano Ronaldo's desire to play and add to his European Championships goal tally shouldn’t be underestimated.
If Ronaldo features on Wednesday, his anytime assist prop jumps out as the best value.
Diogo Jota had a goal disallowed in the opener against Czechia and has some substitute minutes under his belt.
Khvicha Kvaratskhelia is at the forefront for Georgia.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be held at VELTINS-Arena, Gelsenkirchen, Germany.
The game is scheduled for Wednesday, June 26, 2024, at 3:00 p.m. ET.
The weather is expected to be partly cloudy and humid, with temperatures in the low 80s.
